content: laughing purple goldfish designs ©2013 3 pattern begins please note that the sample owl photographed on the front page is a small owl body the body is worked with three strands of yarn worked together as one use one strand each of c1 eggplant c2 grey and c3 teal begin at base use the 6 5 mm hook please note that the body is worked in spirals do not join the rounds use your stitch marker to keep track of the beginning of each round mini owl work to the end of round 4 of the basic increase instructions on p4 24 single_crochet 10cm 4 in tall work 10 rounds of single_crochet leave a 45 cm 18 in tail for seaming and fasten_off small owl work to the end of round 5 of the basic increase instructions on p4 30 single_crochet 14 cm 5 ½ in tall work 15 rounds of single_crochet leave a 45 cm 18 in tail for seaming and fasten_off medium owl work to the end of round 6 of the basic increase instructions on p4 36 single_crochet 18 cm 7 in tall work 20 rounds of single_crochet leave a 45 cm 18 in tail for seaming and fasten_off large owl work to the end of round 7 of the basic increase instructions on p4 42 single_crochet 22 cm 8 ¾ in tall work 25 rounds of single_crochet leave a 45 cm 18 in tail for seaming and fasten_off eyes the eyes are worked with a single strand of c4 white begin at the centre of eye use the 3 5 mm hook please note that the eyes are worked in spirals do not join the rounds use your stitch marker to keep track of the beginning of each round mini owl left eye -
